alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Eastern Kent; Newport; Northwest Providence; Southeast Providence; Washington; Western Kent (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 1:51PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Thunderstorms will bring heavy rainfall to portions of southern New England through 245 PM EDT... At 149 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Marlborough to North Smithfield to Duxbury. Movement was northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Providence, Hartford, New Bedford, Brockton, Quincy, Fall River, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, West Hartford, Manchester, Plymouth, Taunton, Weymouth, East Hartford, East Providence, Woonsocket, Braintree, Glastonbury, and Cumberland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. These storms may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.
